author.name: Customer | Fresh ideas by you - butterbee

description: Super easy dip which is a crowd pleaser. The mixture can be prepared ahead of a party and bake when ready to serve hot.
keywords: Dip & spread,High fibre,High protein,Cob loaf,Low sugar,Spinach
name: Spinach Dip in Cob Loaf Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 160 degrees fan forced.
Cut off top of loaf (about 3cm) to form lid. Scoop out bread from centre of loaf and tear into small pieces.
Squeeze out excess liquid from spinach.
In a bowl, combine spinach, cream cheese, sour cream and french onion soup mix. Mix everything together nicely. Freeze the mixture for at least an hour to enable the flavours to combine properly.
Add the mixture into the cob and place the lid. Add the bread pieces in a single layer around the cob. Bake in oven for 20 minutes at 160 degrees fan forced. Serve hot.
